citeinfo.origin: New York City Department of City Planning
citeinfo.title: NHoodNameCentroids

pubinfo.publish: City of New York Department of City Planning

citeinfo.othercit: The "New York: A City of Neighborhoods" files have undergone minor revisions since the 2006 release. The revisions include modification of neighborhood centroids positions, additions of neighborhood labels, or the removal of the neighborhood labels. Documentation of changes and additions to the 2006 version of "New York: A City of Neighborhoods" is located under Data Quality/Process Step Information sections of metadata.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000

descript.abstract: These points were created as a guide to the locations of neighborhood labels found on the Department of City Planning's "New York: A City of Neighborhoods" poster and webpage. Best estimates of label centroids were established at a 1:1,000 scale, but are ideally viewed at a 1:50,000 scale.
descript.purpose: These points were created by the Department of City Planning as a guide to the locations of neighborhood labels found on the Department of City Planning's "New York: A City of Neighborhoods" poster and webpage.

cntorgp.cntorg: New York City Department of City Planning

cntinfo.cntpos: BYTES of the BIG APPLE Coordinator

citeinfo.title: Population Division, New York City Department of City Planning

idinfo.accconst: The data are freely available to all New York City agencies and the public.
idinfo.useconst: While all possible measures have been taken to ensure the accuracy of this data, the NYC Department of City Planning and the City of New York assume no responsibility for the accuracy of this data. All users should independently verify the accuracy of the data for their purposes.

procstep.procdesc: The "New York: A City of Neighborhoods" files have undergone minor revisions since the 2006 release. The revisions include modification of neighborhood centroids positions, additions of neighborhood labels, or the removal of the neighborhood labels. Documentation of changes and additions to the 2006 version of "New York: A City of Neighborhoods" is listed below.
The Queens neighborhood Jamaica Hill was changed to the preferred name Jamaica Hills.
Plumb Beach Gateway National Recreation Area in Brooklyn was removed from the neighborhood layer.

attracc.attraccr: While all possible measures have been taken to ensure the accuracy of this data, the NYC Department of City Planning and the City of New York assume no responsibility for the accuracy of this data. All users should independently verify the accuracy of the data for their purposes.

horizpa.horizpar: Best estimates of label centroids were established at a 1:1,000 scale, but are ideally viewed at a 1:50,000 scale.

dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

cntorgp.cntper: REQUIRED: The person responsible for the metadata information.
cntorgp.cntorg: REQUIRED: The organization responsible for the metadata information.

cntaddr.addrtype: REQUIRED: The mailing and/or physical address for the organization or individual.
cntaddr.city: REQUIRED: The city of the address.
cntaddr.state: REQUIRED: The state or province of the address.
cntaddr.postal: REQUIRED: The ZIP or other postal code of the address.

cntinfo.cntvoice: REQUIRED: The telephone number by which individuals can speak to the organization or individual.

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

overview.dsoverv: These points were created as a guide to the locations of neighborhood labels found on the Department of City Planning's "New York: A City of Neighborhoods" poster and webpage. Best estimates of label centroids were established at a 1:1,000 scale, but are ideally viewed at a 1:50,000 scale.
overview.eaover: The "New York: A City of Neighborhoods" files have undergone minor revisions since the 2006 release. The revisions include modification of neighborhood centroids positions, additions of neighborhood labels, or the removal of the neighborhood labels. Documentation of changes and additions to the 2006 version of "New York: A City of Neighborhoods" is located under Data Quality/Process Step Information sections of metadata.
